CpG flanking sequence preferences.Measurement: Proportion of methylated CpGs in R882/WT preferred contexts
CpG flanking sequence preferences.Description: DNMT3A R882H and similar mutations change the CpG flanking sequence preferences.
CpG flanking sequence preferences.Experiment: Libraries containing CpG in 10nt random context were exposed to mutant/WT methyltransferases then bisulfite sequenced.

Hemimethylation Burden.Measurement: Proportion of CpGs which are hemimethylated
Hemimethylation Burden.Description: DNMT1 maintenance methyltransferase should decrease hemimethylation

Clonal Deletions.Measurement: Clonal/Subclonal ratio of Deletions to Insertions
Clonal Deletions.Description: Radiation Induced Cancers have early and clonal radiation induced mutations.
Clonal Deletions.Experiment: Analysis of 12 radiation-associated tumours from 3 cancer types compared to radiation-naive tumours
Clonal Deletions.OtherProcesses: Clonal radiation-induced mutations are not unique to non-radiation induced cancer. For example, a radiotherapy-damaged subclone may simply expand due to radiosensitivity of the dominant clone.
Clonal Deletions.SensitivityTooltip: 3/3 tumours with subclones, deletions were significantly increased compared with insertions amongst clonal mutations in all three cases

Glioblastoma Expression Signature.Description: Paediatric glioblastomas were shown to have a pattern of expression distinct from those that spontaneuosly arise
Glioblastoma Expression Signature.Experiment: gene expression microarray profiling of 5 paediatric radiation induced glioblastomas compared to spontaneous tumours

High Deletion Burden.Description: Higher number of small deletions (1-100bp) particularly in reagions of microhomology
High Deletion Burden.Experiment: Analysis of 12 radiation-associated tumours from 3 cancer types compared to radiation-naive tumours
High Deletion Burden.OtherProcesses: Also observed in BRCA1/BRCA2 breast cancer
High Deletion Burden.SensitivityTooltip: 11/12 tumours had values exceeding the median for their cancer type

High Indel Burden.Description: Higher number of INDELS. Driven by an increased burden of deletions, not insertions.
High Indel Burden.Experiment: Analysis of 12 radiation-associated tumours from 3 cancer types compared to radiation-naive tumours
High Indel Burden.OtherProcesses: Also observed in BRCA1/BRCA2 breast cancer
High Indel Burden.SensitivityTooltip: All radiation tumours had values exceeding the median for their cancer type

Increased balanced inversions.Description: Balanced inversions, a rare type of rearrangement, were present in 92% (11/12) radiation-associated tumours but only 15% of radiation naïve tumours.
Increased balanced inversions.Experiment: Analysis of 12 radiation-associated tumours from 3 cancer types compared to radiation-naive tumours
Increased balanced inversions.OtherProcesses: Present in 58% of BRCA1/2-deficient breast tumours
Increased balanced inversions.SensitivityTooltip: Present in 92% (11/12) radiation-associated tumours but only 15% of radiation naïve tumours.

Topography Agnostic Deletions.Measurement: Genome-wide deletion distribution and topographical features
Topography Agnostic Deletions.Description: Radiation induced deletions appear uniformally across the genome irregardless of replication timing and chromotin structure (unlike most other exogenous mutagens).
Topography Agnostic Deletions.Experiment: Analysis of 12 radiation-associated tumours from 3 cancer types compared to radiation-naive tumours
Topography Agnostic Deletions.OtherProcesses: No other mutagenic process has this level of indifference to DNA topography
